questionText: How does taxonomy help scientists organize all the different animals on Earth?
Why do you think scientists use Latin names instead of regular names for animals?
How does taxonomy help scientists understand our world? How can we use taxonomy to better understand animals?
What are some traits that scientists use to classify animals into different groups?
What happens if a new animal is discovered that doesn’t fit into any known category?
Why do you think it is important for scientists all over the world to use the same classification system?
How does Darwin’s theory help us understand why animals look and act the way they do?
Why do you think animals with special adaptations, like camouflage or long necks, have an advantage?
How do different species compete for food, and how does that affect their survival?
What concept did this game demonstrate?
The more species diversifies, the less likely it is to go extinct. Why is that?
What do you think is more important for survival: strength, intelligence, or speed? Why?
What does population density mean and how does it affect the way animals live in different environments?
Which is which?
Why do some places have more animals than others? What factors influence this?
How do changes in the environment, like deforestation or pollution, affect animal distribution?
Why are biodiversity and conservation important? Why do distribution patterns vary per region?
Why do some animals live in groups while others live alone?
If you were a zoologist, how would you study where animals live and why?
How do animals use sounds, body language, and scents to communicate with each other?
Why do different animals have different behaviors, even if they live in the same place?
How do animals like wolves, bees, or ants work together as a group?
How do behaviors of an animal link to its ability to survive? How does this affect other animals?
How do animals teach their young important survival skills?
What do you think would happen if an animal’s behavior changed because of humans or the environment?
What are some examples of animals, besides butterflies, that go through metamorphosis, and why do they change?
How do scientists study animal anatomy to understand their behaviors and needs?
Why do some animals have very strong senses, like eagles with sharp vision or dogs with powerful noses?
How does an animal’s anatomy affect what it eats and how it hunts?
What is the purpose of studying anatomy and the bodily functions of animals?
If you could study one animal’s anatomy up close, which one would you choose and why?
